About

I am a professor of mathematics at Tulane University. My work spans algebraic groups and monoids, representation theory, algebraic geometry, and the mathematics of secure communication. I am interested in how algebraic structure clarifies complex systems—whether in geometry, number theory, or coding theory.

Research

Recent projects include geometric approaches to representation theory, classification problems for algebraic monoids, and algebraic constructions for error-correcting codes. For additional details, see the Research page or my CV.

Teaching & mentorship

I teach undergraduate and graduate courses in analysis, algebra, and geometry, and I regularly supervise PhD students and undergraduate researchers. Current teaching information is posted on Canvas for enrolled students; a summary of recent courses lives on the Teaching page.
